title: Mursili II launches a campaign against the Kingdom of Azzi-Hayasa.
text: redirect" title="1312 BC">1312 BC – Mursili II launches a campaign against the Kingdom of Azzi-Hayasa.

title: The Romans, led by Gaius Flaminius, are ambushed and defeated by Hannibal at the Battle of Lake Trasimene.
text: The Romans, led by Gaius Flaminius, are ambushed and defeated by Hannibal at the Battle of Lake Trasimene.

title: Roman emperor Trajan inaugurates the Aqua Traiana, an aqueduct that channels water from Lake Bracciano, 40 kilometres (25 miles) north-west of Rome.
text: Roman emperor Trajan inaugurates the Aqua Traiana, an aqueduct that channels water from Lake Bracciano, 40 kilometres (25 miles) north-west of Rome.

title: Julius Nepos forces Roman usurper Glycerius to abdicate the throne and proclaims himself Emperor of the Western Roman Empire.
text: Julius Nepos forces Roman usurper Glycerius to abdicate the throne and proclaims himself Emperor of the Western Roman Empire.

title: The Battle of Moira is fought between the High King of Ireland and the Kings of Ulster and Dál Riata. It is claimed to be the largest battle in the history of Ireland.
text: The Battle of Moira is fought between the High King of Ireland and the Kings of Ulster and Dál Riata. It is claimed to be the largest battle in the history of Ireland.

title: Battle of Cedynia, the first documented victory of Polish forces, takes place.
text: Battle of Cedynia, the first documented victory of Polish forces, takes place.

title: Battle of São Mamede, near Guimarães: Forces led by Afonso I defeat forces led by his mother Teresa of León and her lover Fernando Pérez de Traba.
text: Battle of São Mamede, near Guimarães: Forces led by Afonso I defeat forces led by his mother Teresa of León and her lover Fernando Pérez de Traba.

title: The Siege of Jaén started in the context of the Spanish Reconquista.
text: The Siege of Jaén started in the context of the Spanish Reconquista.

title: First War of Scottish Independence: The Battle of Bannockburn concludes with a decisive victory by Scottish forces led by Robert the Bruce.
text: First War of Scottish Independence: The Battle of Bannockburn concludes with a decisive victory by Scottish forces led by Robert the Bruce.

title: Hundred Years' War: Battle of Sluys: The French fleet is almost completely destroyed by the English fleet commanded in person by King Edward III.
text: Hundred Years' War: Battle of Sluys: The French fleet is almost completely destroyed by the English fleet commanded in person by King Edward III.

title: A sudden outbreak of St. John's Dance causes people in the streets of Aachen, Germany, to experience hallucinations and begin to jump and twitch uncontrollably until they collapse from exhaustion.
text: A sudden outbreak of St. John's Dance causes people in the streets of Aachen, Germany, to experience hallucinations and begin to jump and twitch uncontrollably until they collapse from exhaustion.

title: John Cabot lands in North America at Newfoundland leading the first European exploration of the region since the Vikings.
text: John Cabot lands in North America at Newfoundland leading the first European exploration of the region since the Vikings.

title: Henry VIII and Catherine of Aragon are crowned King and Queen of England.
text: Henry VIII and Catherine of Aragon are crowned King and Queen of England.

title: The Anabaptist state of Münster is conquered and disbanded.
text: The Anabaptist state of Münster is conquered and disbanded.

title: Miguel López de Legazpi founds Manila, the capital of the Republic of the Philippines.
text: Miguel López de Legazpi founds Manila, the capital of the Republic of the Philippines.

title: The first Dutch voyage to the East Indies reaches Banten, Java.[citation needed][1]
text: The first Dutch voyage to the East Indies reaches Banten, Java.[citation needed][1]

title: Samuel de Champlain discovers the mouth of the Saint John River, site of Reversing Falls and the present day city of Saint John, New Brunswick, Canada.
text: Samuel de Champlain discovers the mouth of the Saint John River, site of Reversing Falls and the present day city of Saint John, New Brunswick, Canada.

title: Battle of Macau: The Dutch attempt but fail to capture Macau.
text: Battle of Macau: The Dutch attempt but fail to capture Macau.

title: The Premier Grand Lodge of England, the first Masonic Grand Lodge in the world (now the United Grand Lodge of England), is founded in London.
text: The Premier Grand Lodge of England, the first Masonic Grand Lodge in the world (now the United Grand Lodge of England), is founded in London.

title: Battle of Wilhelmsthal: The British-Hanoverian army of Ferdinand of Brunswick defeats French forces in Westphalia.
text: Battle of Wilhelmsthal: The British-Hanoverian army of Ferdinand of Brunswick defeats French forces in Westphalia.

title: American Revolutionary War: The Great Siege of Gibraltar begins.
text: American Revolutionary War: The Great Siege of Gibraltar begins.

title: The first Republican constitution in France is adopted.
text: The first Republican constitution in France is adopted.

title: Napoleonic Wars: Napoleon's Grande Armée crosses the Neman river beginning the invasion of Russia.
text: Napoleonic Wars: Napoleon's Grande Armée crosses the Neman river beginning the invasion of Russia.

title: Battle of Beaver Dams: A British and Indian combined force defeats the United States Army.
text: Battle of Beaver Dams: A British and Indian combined force defeats the United States Army.

title: The Battle of Carabobo takes place. It is the decisive battle in the war of independence of Venezuela from Spain.
text: The Battle of Carabobo takes place. It is the decisive battle in the war of independence of Venezuela from Spain.

title: Battle of Solferino (Battle of the Three Sovereigns): Sardinia and France defeat Austria in Solferino, northern Italy.
text: Battle of Solferino (Battle of the Three Sovereigns): Sardinia and France defeat Austria in Solferino, northern Italy.

title: Battle of Custoza: An Austrian army defeats the Italian army during the Austro-Prussian War.
text: Battle of Custoza: An Austrian army defeats the Italian army during the Austro-Prussian War.

title: First performance of O Canada, the song that would become the national anthem of Canada, at the Congrès national des Canadiens-Français.
text: First performance of O Canada, the song that would become the national anthem of Canada, at the Congrès national des Canadiens-Français.

title: Marie François Sadi Carnot is assassinated by Sante Geronimo Caserio.
text: Marie François Sadi Carnot is assassinated by Sante Geronimo Caserio.

title: King Edward VII of the United Kingdom develops appendicitis, delaying his coronation.
text: King Edward VII of the United Kingdom develops appendicitis, delaying his coronation.

title: Greece and Serbia annul their alliance with Bulgaria.
text: Greece and Serbia annul their alliance with Bulgaria.

title: Mary Pickford becomes the first female film star to sign a million-dollar contract.
text: Mary Pickford becomes the first female film star to sign a million-dollar contract.

title: First airmail service in Canada from Montreal to Toronto.
text: First airmail service in Canada from Montreal to Toronto.

title: The American Professional Football Association is renamed the National Football League.
text: The American Professional Football Association is renamed the National Football League.

title: A bloodless revolution instigated by the People's Party ends the absolute power of King Prajadhipok of Siam (now Thailand).
text: A bloodless revolution instigated by the People's Party ends the absolute power of King Prajadhipok of Siam (now Thailand).

title: Pieces of a meteorite, estimated to have weighed 450 metric tons when it hit the Earth's atmosphere and exploded, land near Chicora, Pennsylvania.
text: Pieces of a meteorite, estimated to have weighed 450 metric tons when it hit the Earth's atmosphere and exploded, land near Chicora, Pennsylvania.

title: Siam is renamed Thailand by Plaek Phibunsongkhram, the country's third prime minister.
text: Siam is renamed Thailand by Plaek Phibunsongkhram, the country's third prime minister.

title: World War II: Operation Collar, the first British Commando raid on occupied France, by No 11 Independent Company.
text: World War II: Operation Collar, the first British Commando raid on occupied France, by No 11 Independent Company.

title: US military police attempt to arrest a black soldier in Bamber Bridge, England, sparking the Battle of Bamber Bridge mutiny that leaves one dead and seven wounded.
text: US military police attempt to arrest a black soldier in Bamber Bridge, England, sparking the Battle of Bamber Bridge mutiny that leaves one dead and seven wounded.

title: Kenneth Arnold makes the first widely reported UFO sighting near Mount Rainier, Washington.
text: Kenneth Arnold makes the first widely reported UFO sighting near Mount Rainier, Washington.

title: Cold War: Start of the Berlin Blockade: The Soviet Union makes overland travel between West Germany and West Berlin impossible.
text: Cold War: Start of the Berlin Blockade: The Soviet Union makes overland travel between West Germany and West Berlin impossible.

title: The first television western, Hopalong Cassidy, is aired on NBC starring William Boyd.
text: The first television western, Hopalong Cassidy, is aired on NBC starring William Boyd.

title: Apartheid: In South Africa, the Group Areas Act formally segregating races is passed.
text: Apartheid: In South Africa, the Group Areas Act formally segregating races is passed.

title: First Indochina War: Battle of Mang Yang Pass: Viet Minh troops belonging to the 803rd Regiment ambush G.M. 100 of France in An Khê.
text: First Indochina War: Battle of Mang Yang Pass: Viet Minh troops belonging to the 803rd Regiment ambush G.M. 100 of France in An Khê.

title: In Roth v. United States, the U.S. Supreme Court rules that obscenity is not protected by the First Amendment.
text: In Roth v. United States, the U.S. Supreme Court rules that obscenity is not protected by the First Amendment.

title: The United Kingdom grants Zanzibar internal self-government.
text: The United Kingdom grants Zanzibar internal self-government.

title: The UpStairs Lounge arson attack takes place at a gay bar located on the second floor of the three-story building at 141 Chartres Street in the French Quarter of New Orleans, Louisiana, USA. Thirty-two people die as a result of fire or smoke inhalation.
text: The UpStairs Lounge arson attack takes place at a gay bar located on the second floor of the three-story building at 141 Chartres Street in the French Quarter of New Orleans, Louisiana, USA. Thirty-two people die as a result of fire or smoke inhalation.

title: The Humber Bridge opens to traffic, connecting Yorkshire and Lincolnshire. It would be the world's longest bridge span for 17 years.
text: The Humber Bridge opens to traffic, connecting Yorkshire and Lincolnshire. It would be the world's longest bridge span for 17 years.

title: "The Jakarta Incident": British Airways Flight 9 flies into a cloud of volcanic ash thrown up by the eruption of Mount Galunggung, resulting in the failure of all four engines.
text: "The Jakarta Incident": British Airways Flight 9 flies into a cloud of volcanic ash thrown up by the eruption of Mount Galunggung, resulting in the failure of all four engines.

title: Jiang Zemin succeeds Zhao Ziyang to become the General Secretary of the Communist Party of China after the Tiananmen Square protests of 1989.
text: Jiang Zemin succeeds Zhao Ziyang to become the General Secretary of the Communist Party of China after the Tiananmen Square protests of 1989.

title: "Rugby World Cup final": South Africa defeats New Zealand, Nelson Mandela presents Francois Pienaar with the Webb-Ellis trophy in an iconic post-apartheid moment.
text: "Rugby World Cup final": South Africa defeats New Zealand, Nelson Mandela presents Francois Pienaar with the Webb-Ellis trophy in an iconic post-apartheid moment.

title: The Igandu train disaster in Tanzania kills 281, the worst train accident in African history.
text: The Igandu train disaster in Tanzania kills 281, the worst train accident in African history.

title: In New York, capital punishment is declared unconstitutional.
text: In New York, capital punishment is declared unconstitutional.

title: John Isner of the United States defeats Nicolas Mahut of France at Wimbledon, in the longest match in professional tennis history.
text: John Isner of the United States defeats Nicolas Mahut of France at Wimbledon, in the longest match in professional tennis history.

title: Julia Gillard assumes office as the first female Prime Minister of Australia.
text: Julia Gillard assumes office as the first female Prime Minister of Australia.

title: Lonesome George, the last known individual of Chelonoidis nigra abingdonii, a subspecies of the Galápagos tortoise, dies.
text: Lonesome George, the last known individual of Chelonoidis nigra abingdonii, a subspecies of the Galápagos tortoise, dies.

title: Former Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi is found guilty of abusing his power and having sex with an underage prostitute, and is sentenced to seven years in prison.
text: Former Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi is found guilty of abusing his power and having sex with an underage prostitute, and is sentenced to seven years in prison.
